newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish Riksbank says crown weakness not dramatic.
newsitem.headline: Swedish Riksbank says crown weakness not dramatic.

text.p: The current weakness in the crown need not be dramatic but neither is it a laughing matter, the Riksbank said on Thursday.
Riksbank deputy governor Lars Heikensten said a reason for the weakness was uncertainty about political economics in the longer term.
"I don't think the crown weakening is dramatic but nor is it a laughing matter," Heikensten told a news conference.
"It is a rather strong weakening that has occurred over a long period.
"There are a number of explanations for this. One is that there is some uncertainty about political economics, mainly in the outlook for the next five to ten years."

Heikensten said other issues that have weakened the crown were Sweden's position on Europe's economic and monetary union (EMU), a commission about how foreign exchange policy will be driven in the future and uncertainty about fiscal policy.
"People are among other things uncertain about the attitude to the EMU question," Heikensten said.
Another key reason for the crown weakening could be the fears among money market playets about the positions they have taken, Heikensten said.
The crown has softened around six percent since October to a level of 4.5510 against the mark at midday Thursday.
